intro: Lotononis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. It is an herbaceous perennial that produces seeds in small, dry capsules. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
